page.title: 10Elsenham CofE Primary School
page.content: and finishes at 3pm. Clubs are run after school. No uniforms are worn. Most of the teachers had taught at the school for many years. The youngest teacher was 35 years old. Parents regularly come to the school to help in the classrooms. At 11 years old pupils transfer to secondary schools. This necessitates their travelling on school buses to nearby towns. The Headmistress, who retires in July 1985 after over 30 years at the school, describes the village as very pleasant but not beautiful. Mainly young people live in the village, the older people tending to move to bigger towns. She thought of the people as very friendly, kind and hard working.
